defs.name: value_from_str
defs.value:
pub fn value_from_str<A, T>(&mut Self, A) -> Result<T, Error> where
A: Into<Keys>, T: FromStr, <T as FromStr>::Err: Display
defs.docs: Parses a key-value pair using `FromStr` trait.

attributes.value: / Parses a key-value pair using `FromStr` trait.
/ This is a shorthand for `value_from_fn("--key", FromStr::from_str)`

defs.name: value_from_fn
defs.value:
pub fn value_from_fn<A: Into<Keys>, T,
                     E: Display>(&mut Self, A, fn(: &str) -> Result<T, E>)
-> Result<T, Error>
defs.docs: Parses a key-value pair using a specified function.

attributes.value: / Parses a key-value pair using a specified function.
/ When a key-value pair is separated by a space, the algorithm
/ will threat the next argument after the key as a value,
/ even if it has a `-/--` prefix.
/ So a key-value pair like `--key --value` is not an error.
/ Must be used only once for each option.
/ # Errors
/ - When option is not present.
/ - When key or value is not a UTF-8 string. Use [`value_from_os_str`] instead.
/ - When value parsing failed.
/ - When key-value pair is separated not by space or `=`.
/ [`value_from_os_str`]: struct.Arguments.html#method.value_from_os_str

defs.name: opt_value_from_str
defs.value:
pub fn opt_value_from_str<A, T>(&mut Self, A) -> Result<Option<T>, Error>
where A: Into<Keys>, T: FromStr, <T as FromStr>::Err: Display
defs.docs: Parses an optional key-value pair using `FromStr` trait.

attributes.value: / Parses an optional key-value pair using `FromStr` trait.
/ This is a shorthand for `opt_value_from_fn("--key", FromStr::from_str)`

defs.name: opt_value_from_fn
defs.value:
pub fn opt_value_from_fn<A: Into<Keys>, T,
                         E: Display>(&mut Self, A, fn(: &str) -> Result<T, E>)
-> Result<Option<T>, Error>
defs.docs: Parses an optional key-value pair using a specified function.

attributes.value: / Parses an optional key-value pair using a specified function.
/ The same as [`value_from_fn`], but returns `Ok(None)` when option is not present.
/ [`value_from_fn`]: struct.Arguments.html#method.value_from_fn

defs.value:
pub fn values_from_str<A, T>(&mut Self, A) -> Result<Vec<T>, Error> where
A: Into<Keys>, T: FromStr, <T as FromStr>::Err: Display
defs.docs: Parses multiple key-value pairs into the `Vec` using `FromStr` trait.

attributes.value: / Parses multiple key-value pairs into the `Vec` using `FromStr` trait.
/ This is a shorthand for `values_from_fn("--key", FromStr::from_str)`

defs.name: values_from_fn
defs.value:
pub fn values_from_fn<A: Into<Keys>, T,
                      E: Display>(&mut Self, A, fn(: &str) -> Result<T, E>)
-> Result<Vec<T>, Error>
defs.docs: Parses multiple key-value pairs into the `Vec` using a specified function.

attributes.value: / Parses multiple key-value pairs into the `Vec` using a specified function.
/ This functions can be used to parse arguments like:
/ `--file /path1 --file /path2 --file /path3`
/ But not `--file /path1 /path2 /path3`.
/ Arguments can also be separated: `--file /path1 --some-flag --file /path2`
/ This method simply executes [`opt_value_from_fn`] multiple times.
/ An empty `Vec` is not an error.
/ [`opt_value_from_fn`]: struct.Arguments.html#method.opt_value_from_fn

defs.name: value_from_os_str
defs.value:
pub fn value_from_os_str<A: Into<Keys>, T,
                         E: Display>(&mut Self, A,
                                     fn(: &OsStr) -> Result<T, E>)
-> Result<T, Error>
defs.docs: Parses a key-value pair using a specified function.

attributes.value: / Parses a key-value pair using a specified function.
/ Unlike [`value_from_fn`], parses `&OsStr` and not `&str`.
/ Must be used only once for each option.
/ # Errors
/ - When option is not present.
/ - When value parsing failed.
/ - When key-value pair is separated not by space.
/   Only [`value_from_fn`] supports `=` separator.
/ [`value_from_fn`]: struct.Arguments.html#method.value_from_fn

defs.value:
pub fn opt_value_from_os_str<A: Into<Keys>, T,
                             E: Display>(&mut Self, A,
                                         fn(: &OsStr) -> Result<T, E>)
-> Result<Option<T>, Error>
defs.docs: Parses an optional key-value pair using a specified function.

attributes.value: / Parses an optional key-value pair using a specified function.
/ The same as `value_from_os_str`, but returns `Ok(None)` when option is not present.
/ [`value_from_os_str`]: struct.Arguments.html#method.value_from_os_str

defs.name: values_from_os_str
defs.value:
pub fn values_from_os_str<A: Into<Keys>, T,
                          E: Display>(&mut Self, A,
                                      fn(: &OsStr) -> Result<T, E>)
-> Result<Vec<T>, Error>
defs.docs: Parses multiple key-value pairs into the `Vec` using a specified function.

attributes.value: / Parses multiple key-value pairs into the `Vec` using a specified function.
/ This method simply executes [`opt_value_from_os_str`] multiple times.
/ Unlike [`values_from_fn`], parses `&OsStr` and not `&str`.
/ An empty `Vec` is not an error.
/ [`opt_value_from_os_str`]: struct.Arguments.html#method.opt_value_from_os_str
/ [`values_from_fn`]: struct.Arguments.html#method.values_from_fn

defs.name: free_from_fn
defs.value:
pub fn free_from_fn<T, E: Display>(&mut Self, fn(: &str) -> Result<T, E>)
-> Result<Option<T>, Error>
defs.docs: Parses a free-standing argument using a specified function.

attributes.value: / Parses a free-standing argument using a specified function.
/ Must be used only once for each argument.
/ # Errors
/ - When any flags are left.
/ - When argument is not a UTF-8 string. Use [`free_from_os_str`] instead.
/ - When value parsing failed.
/ [`value_from_os_str`]: struct.Arguments.html#method.value_from_os_str
inline(never)

-> Result<Option<T>, Error>

attributes.value: / Parses a free-standing argument using a specified function.
/ Must be used only once for each argument.
/ # Errors
/ - When any flags are left.
/ - When value parsing failed.
inline(never)

defs.name: free
defs.value: pub fn free(Self) -> Result<Vec<String>, Error>
defs.docs: Returns a list of free arguments as Strings.

attributes.value: / Returns a list of free arguments as Strings.
/ This list will also include `-`, which indicates stdin.
/ # Errors
/ - When any flags are left.
/ - When any of the arguments is not a UTF-8 string.

defs.name: free_os
defs.value: pub fn free_os(Self) -> Result<Vec<OsString>, Error>
defs.docs: Returns a list of free arguments as OsStrings.

attributes.value: / Returns a list of free arguments as OsStrings.
/ This list will also include `-`, which indicates stdin.
/ # Errors
/ - When any flags are left.
/   Only UTF-8 strings will be checked for flag prefixes.
